result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brenda J. Smetak

defendant.name: Smetak, Brenda J.
defendant.address: W7966 Division St, Park Falls, WI

records.addlTxt: 11:05 AM DA Kelz calls case and states appearances. Prosecuting attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brenda J. Smetak not in court. Court goes over the case history of appearances and notices sent. Notice was sent to defendant at her last known address and has not been returned undeliverable. DA Kelz motions for a bench warrant in the amount of $2,500. So ordered plus warrant fee. Court will hold the warrant until 12pm on 06/24/2022. DA Kelz motions for bond forfeiture proceedings to begin. Court will hold that request in abeyance at this time. Back on record at 11:21 AM defendant appears in person. Court questions defendant on non appearance earlier. Defendant gives comments. Court vacates its previous order for the warrant. Court questions defendant on non appearance at Pre Trial Conference. Defendant comments. DA Kelz requests another Pre Trial Conference be set for 07/19/2022 at 1:30 PM. Court also sets a status hearing.
Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel
Motion and prop. order for withdrawal of counsel
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 10:11 AM Defendant Brenda J. Smetak appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE. Bond already set and is to continue. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA

DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant appeared via video from Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE next court date is 03/22/22 at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Bond set as requested.

Defendant may not have contact with M.V, H.R, and A.S, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk of Courts office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriffs Department.
Defendant not to go upon the property of: 1130 South 4th Avenue Park Falls, Wl 54552 (BP Gas Station)
Defendant may not have contact with anyone known to use or manufactureMethamphetamines
Defendant shall not possess or purchase Pseudoephedrine unless possessing a valid prescription from a licensed healthcare provider
